for_sales.sales_text:
Loch Broom Post boat 2004. GRP gaff sloop family cruising dinghy with bow sprit. 14’6” LOA, plus bowsprit. 6’8” beam.

A sea worthy craft that has good ability on all points of sailing that you can sail sitting insdie the roomy cockpit. No centre plate. Suitable for estuary, loch, lake and inshore coastal use.

Very stable boat with a roomy cockpit. Long shallow keel, 18” draft aft, 12” draft forward. Dark blue original gell coat topsides in very good condition. Original white gell coat for and aft decks and inside cockpit area in VGC. Large hinged lockers for and aft. Varnished hardwood gunwhales. Thwarts and floors. Varnished mast and spare with white mainsail and furling jib. Sails laundered 2020 with new UV strip on jib, August 2020

Barn door style large varnished hardwood rudder with a long curving tiller enabling helm to sit amidship. Spray hood with alloy frame.

Outboard well, with Yamaha 4hp 4 stroke long shaft.

Cover, anchor and fenders. Dutch galvanised trailer 2004, single axle unbraked, winch, sealed bearings, 5 stud rims, large heavy duty tires. New spare wheel. Has break back option, boat can be launched and recovered single handed.

The owner is a 75 year olf former boat builder and sailing coach, now hobby boat restorer, who has owned and sailed several of these Loch Broom boats over the past 30 years. This one was completed by a boat yard in Holland under license and has had 2 prior owners. It is a fine example of its type, that currently sells new for £17,500 with trailer and outboard. Grab a bargian at £5,000

If required the owner will spend half a day afloat/ashore with the buyer. View in SW Scotland near Castle Douglas. Delivery for fuel cost in UK
